meanings.definition: To enter a wrong key on a keyboard or typewriter.
meanings.sent1: I always miskey the password when I type too quickly.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to miskey the code when unlocking the door.
meanings.sent3: It's frustrating to miskey the same letter over and over.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers seemed to miskey the notes on the piano, creating a jumbled melody.
meanings.sent5: The student's tendency to miskey numbers led to frequent errors in calculations.

meanings.definition: A key that has been entered incorrectly on a keyboard or typewriter.
meanings.sent1: The miskey on the keyboard made it difficult to type smoothly.
meanings.sent2: I had to fix the miskey before the document could be printed correctly.
meanings.sent3: The miskey on the typewriter caused the entire page to be misaligned.
meanings.sent4: The miskey stood out among the other keys, looking out of place.
meanings.sent5: She noticed the miskey immediately and knew she had to retype the sentence.
